law.catch_line: Each county board shall provide for an annual audit of its financial transactions and accounts....

section.section: Each county board shall provide for an annual audit of its financial transactions and accounts.
At the request of the Department, a county board shall conduct an audit under § 5-203 of this title.

The audit shall be made by a certified public accountant or a partnership of certified public accountants who are:
Licensed by the State Board of Public Accountancy; and
Approved by the State Superintendent.
The audit shall be made in accordance with the standards and regulations adopted by the State Board.
The results of the audit, including the letter of recommendation submitted by the auditor, are a matter of public record.

text.section: In addition to the audit required by this section, the county commissioners or county council may conduct an audit using auditors employed by the county.
